required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Study to Investigate the Pharmacokinetics, Efficacy, Safety and Immunogenicity of a Recombinant FVIII in Patients With Severe Hemophilia A
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Study to Investigate the Pharmacokinetics, Efficacy, Safety and Immunogenicity of Human-cl rhFVIII, a Newly Developed Human Cell-line Derived Recombinant FVIII Concentrate in Previously Treated Patients With Severe Hemophilia A

brief_summary.textblock: This is a clinical study to investigate the pharmacokinetics, efficacy, safety and immunogenicity of human-cl rhFVIII, a newly developed human cell-line derived recombinant FVIII concentrate in previously treated patients with severe Hemophilia A.

primary_outcome.measure: The Area Under the Concentration Curve for Human-cl rhFVIII Compared to Kogenate FS
primary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline (prior to infusion), 0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 1, 3, 6, 9, 12, 24, 30 and 48 hours after the end of the infusion.
primary_outcome.description: After the infusion of 50IU/kg bw of Human-cl rhFVIII and Kogenate FS respectively, FVIII activity levels were measured at various time points before and after the infusion. FVIII level results derived from the chromogenic FVIII assay were used to calculate the mean of the area under the curve normalized to the dose administered.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetic Parameter: Invivo Half-life (T1/2) for Human-cl rhFVIII Compared to Kogenate FS
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline (prior to infusion), 0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 1, 3, 6, 9, 12, 24, 30 and 48 hours after the end of the infusion.
secondary_outcome.description: After the infusion of 50IU/kg bw of Human-cl rhFVIII and Kogenate FS respectively, FVIII activity levels were measured at various time points before and after the infusion. FVIII level results derived from the chromogenic FVIII assay were used to calculate the mean of the area under the curve normalized to the dose administered.

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum Plasma Concentration (Cmax) for Human-cl rhFVIII Compared to Kogenate FS
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline (prior to infusion), 0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 1, 3, 6, 9, 12, 24, 30 and 48 hours after the end of the infusion.
secondary_outcome.description: After the infusion of 50IU/kg bw of Human-cl rhFVIII and Kogenate FS respectively, FVIII activity levels were measured at various time points before and after the infusion. FVIII level results derived from the chromogenic FVIII assay were used to calculate the mean of the area under the curve normalized to the dose administered.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Reach Maximum Plasma Concentration (Tmax) for Human-cl rhFVIII Compared to Kogenate FS
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline (prior to infusion), 0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 1, 3, 6, 9, 12, 24, 30 and 48 hours after the end of the infusion.
secondary_outcome.description: After the infusion of 50IU/kg bw of Human-cl rhFVIII and Kogenate FS respectively, FVIII activity levels were measured at various time points before and after the infusion. FVIII level results derived from the chromogenic FVIII assay were used to calculate the mean of the area under the curve normalized to the dose administered.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Residence Time (MRT) for Human-cl rhFVIII Compared to Kogenate FS
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline (prior to infusion), 0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 1, 3, 6, 9, 12, 24, 30 and 48 hours after the end of the infusion.
secondary_outcome.description: After the infusion of 50IU/kg bw of Human-cl rhFVIII and Kogenate FS respectively, FVIII activity levels were measured at various time points before and after the infusion. FVIII level results derived from the chromogenic FVIII assay were used to calculate the mean of the area under the curve normalized to the dose administered.

secondary_outcome.measure: Volume of Distribution at Steady State (Vss) for Human-cl rhFVIII Compared to Kogenate FS
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline (prior to infusion), 0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 1, 3, 6, 9, 12, 24, 30 and 48 hours after the end of the infusion.
secondary_outcome.description: After the infusion of 50IU/kg bw of Human-cl rhFVIII and Kogenate FS respectively, FVIII activity levels were measured at various time points before and after the infusion. FVIII level results derived from the chromogenic FVIII assay were used to calculate the mean of the area under the curve normalized to the dose administered.

secondary_outcome.measure: Clearance (CL) for Human-cl rhFVIII Compared to Kogenate FS
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline (prior to infusion), 0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 1, 3, 6, 9, 12, 24, 30 and 48 hours after the end of the infusion.
secondary_outcome.description: After the infusion of 50IU/kg bw of Human-cl rhFVIII and Kogenate FS respectively, FVIII activity levels were measured at various time points before and after the infusion. FVIII level results derived from the chromogenic FVIII assay were used to calculate the mean of the area under the curve normalized to the dose administered.

secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy of On-demand Treatment of Bleeding Episodes
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From 1st treatment after PK cycle 2 until study end.
secondary_outcome.description: After each infusion of IMP and at the end of a BE, the following efficacy assessment is made by the subject (together with the Investigator in case of on-site treatment): Excellent: Abrupt pain relief and/or unequivocal improvement in objective signs of bleeding within approximately 8 hours after a single infusion. Good: Definite pain relief and/or improvement in signs of bleeding within approximately 8 - 12 hours after an infusion requiring up to 2 infusions for complete resolution. Moderate: Probable or slight beneficial effect within approximately 12 hours after the first infusion requiring more than two infusions for complete resolution. None: No improvement within 12 hours, or worsening of symptoms, requiring more than 2 infusions for complete resolution. The assessment was made at the end of a BE in case more than one infusion was needed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Immunogenicity (Number of Patients That Developed an Inhibitor During the Course of the Study)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: study entry, then immediately before both PK cycles, in the 48 hour sample of both PK cycles, after 10 to 15 EDs with human-cl rhFVIII, at the 3-month visit (± 2 weeks), then every 3 months (± 2 weeks) until study completion, and after >50 EDs (except for
secondary_outcome.description: Inhibitor activity was determined by the modified Bethesda assay (Nijmegen modification) at study entry, then immediately before both PK cycles, in the 48 hour sample of both PK cycles, after 10 to 15 EDs with human-cl rhFVIII, at the 3-month visit (± 2 weeks), then every 3 months (± 2 weeks) until study completion, and after >50 EDs (except for some patients who may finish the study before they achieve 50 EDs), with human-cl rhFVIII (i.e. at the study completion visit).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Severe hemophilia A (FVIII:C <= 1%)
- Male subjects between 12 and 65 years of age
- Body weight 25 kg to 110 kg
- Previously treated with FVIII concentrate for at least 150 EDs
Exclusion Criteria:
- Other coagulation disorder than hemophilia A
- Present or past FVIII inhibitor activity

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The study was conducted at 6 centers in the USA, 2 centers in Germany and 1 center in Bulgaria. The first patient was included on May 27, 2010 and the last patient finished the study on September 18, 2012
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: The patients started the study with a PK period. The PK period had a cross-over design (Kogenate vs Human cl rhFVIII) and subjects received either Kogenate first and Human cl rhFVIII second or vice versa. Once the PK measure had been done, the patient started the treatment period with Human cl rhFVIII only.

group.title: Human c1 rhFVIII First Crossover, Then Treatment
group.description: Participants were randomized to receive Human-cl rhFVIII (50 IU/kg bodyweight) first, then Kogenate FS (50 IU/kg bodyweight)second in the Crossover period. In the Treatment Period, participants received Human-cl rhFVIII (50 IU/kg bodyweight)

group.title: Kogenate First Crossover, Then Treatment
group.description: Participants were randomized to receive Kogenate (50 IU/kg) first (14 days), then Human-cl rhFVIII (50 IU/kg bodyweight) second (14 days) in the Crossover period. In the Treatment Period, participants received Human-cl rhFVIII (50 IU/kg bodyweight)

group.title: Human cl rhFVIII
group.description: Human-cl rhFVIII and Kogenate in cross-over design:50 IU/kg for PK dose

outcome.title: The Area Under the Concentration Curve for Human-cl rhFVIII Compared to Kogenate FS
outcome.description: After the infusion of 50IU/kg bw of Human-cl rhFVIII and Kogenate FS respectively, FVIII activity levels were measured at various time points before and after the infusion. FVIII level results derived from the chromogenic FVIII assay were used to calculate the mean of the area under the curve normalized to the dose administered.
outcome.time_frame: At baseline (prior to infusion), 0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 1, 3, 6, 9, 12, 24, 30 and 48 hours after the end of the infusion.

group.title: Human cl rhFVIII
group.description: Human-cl rhFVIII 50 IU/kg for PK dose

group.title: Kogenate FS
group.description: Kogenate FS 50 IU/kg for PK dose

measure.title: The Area Under the Concentration Curve for Human-cl rhFVIII Compared to Kogenate FS
measure.description: After the infusion of 50IU/kg bw of Human-cl rhFVIII and Kogenate FS respectively, FVIII activity levels were measured at various time points before and after the infusion. FVIII level results derived from the chromogenic FVIII assay were used to calculate the mean of the area under the curve normalized to the dose administered.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: For the comparison of the PK profile of Human-cl rhFVIII with Kogenate, the 90% confidence intervals for the ratio or log-ratio of Human-cl rhFVIII over Kogenate for selected, dose independent or dose adjusted, PK parameters will be presented. In addition a formal statistical procedure will test whether the ratio of mean AUCs is within a 80 to 125% range to show bioequivalence.

FVIII level results derived from the chromogenic FVIII assay were used to calculate the mean of the area under the curve normalized to the dose administered.

outcome.title: Efficacy of On-demand Treatment of Bleeding Episodes
outcome.description: After each infusion of IMP and at the end of a BE, the following efficacy assessment is made by the subject (together with the Investigator in case of on-site treatment): Excellent: Abrupt pain relief and/or unequivocal improvement in objective signs of bleeding within approximately 8 hours after a single infusion. Good: Definite pain relief and/or improvement in signs of bleeding within approximately 8 – 12 hours after an infusion requiring up to 2 infusions for complete resolution. Moderate: Probable or slight beneficial effect within approximately 12 hours after the first infusion requiring more than two infusions for complete resolution. None: No improvement within 12 hours, or worsening of symptoms, requiring more than 2 infusions for complete resolution. The assessment was made at the end of a BE in case more than one infusion was needed.
outcome.time_frame: From 1st treatment after PK cycle 2 until study end.

group.title: Human cl rhFVIII
group.description: Human-cl rhFVIII and Kogenate in cross-over design:50 IU/kg for PK dose

measure.title: Efficacy of On-demand Treatment of Bleeding Episodes
measure.description: After each infusion of IMP and at the end of a BE, the following efficacy assessment is made by the subject (together with the Investigator in case of on-site treatment): Excellent: Abrupt pain relief and/or unequivocal improvement in objective signs of bleeding within approximately 8 hours after a single infusion. Good: Definite pain relief and/or improvement in signs of bleeding within approximately 8 – 12 hours after an infusion requiring up to 2 infusions for complete resolution. Moderate: Probable or slight beneficial effect within approximately 12 hours after the first infusion requiring more than two infusions for complete resolution. None: No improvement within 12 hours, or worsening of symptoms, requiring more than 2 infusions for complete resolution. The assessment was made at the end of a BE in case more than one infusion was needed.

outcome.title: Immunogenicity (Number of Patients That Developed an Inhibitor During the Course of the Study)
outcome.description: Inhibitor activity was determined by the modified Bethesda assay (Nijmegen modification) at study entry, then immediately before both PK cycles, in the 48 hour sample of both PK cycles, after 10 to 15 EDs with human-cl rhFVIII, at the 3-month visit (± 2 weeks), then every 3 months (± 2 weeks) until study completion, and after >50 EDs (except for some patients who may finish the study before they achieve 50 EDs), with human-cl rhFVIII (i.e. at the study completion visit).
outcome.time_frame: study entry, then immediately before both PK cycles, in the 48 hour sample of both PK cycles, after 10 to 15 EDs with human-cl rhFVIII, at the 3-month visit (± 2 weeks), then every 3 months (± 2 weeks) until study completion, and after >50 EDs (except for

group.title: Human cl rhFVIII
group.description: Human-cl rhFVIII and Kogenate in cross-over design:50 IU/kg for PK dose

measure.title: Immunogenicity (Number of Patients That Developed an Inhibitor During the Course of the Study)
measure.description: Inhibitor activity was determined by the modified Bethesda assay (Nijmegen modification) at study entry, then immediately before both PK cycles, in the 48 hour sample of both PK cycles, after 10 to 15 EDs with human-cl rhFVIII, at the 3-month visit (± 2 weeks), then every 3 months (± 2 weeks) until study completion, and after >50 EDs (except for some patients who may finish the study before they achieve 50 EDs), with human-cl rhFVIII (i.e. at the study completion visit).

reported_events.desc: All Adverse events were collected regardless of the intervention. Kogenate is a licensed product and the active ingredient is the same as for the investigational product Human cl rhFVIII. Therefore no distinction was made whether an AE occurred after Kogenate or after Human cl rhFVIII administration.

group.title: Human cl rhFVIII and Kogenate FS
group.description: All participants. Human-cl rhFVIII and Kogenate in cross-over design:50 IU/kg for PK period. After the PK period all participants received Human-cl rhFVIII in the treatment period.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Octapharma agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. Octapharma supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial. Octapharma also reserves the right to review data prior to publishing and provide comments/changes within a certain time period.
